trans-unit.source: Defines a set of members for derived classes to provide options for the masked text box UI type editor.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor> abstract class defines the common set of properties that all mask descriptors must implement.
You can use mask descriptors to create predefined mask options for use in the UI type editor for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MaskedTextBox>.
For example, [!INCLUDE[vsprvs](~/includes/vsprvs-md.md)] provides predefined masks for data such as the Postal Code, time, different date formats, and telephone number.
All predefined masks will be associated with the <xref:System.ComponentModel.MaskedTextProvider> parsing engine.
You can discover <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor> types at design time by querying the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ITypeDiscoveryService> service provider.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor"></xref> class.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.%23ctor%2A> is a compiler-supplied default constructor.
A default constructor is required by the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ITypeDiscoveryService> service provider.
Gets the <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> representing the locale the mask is authored for.
A <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> representing the locale the mask is authored for.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor"></xref> is equal to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.Equals%2A> method determines whether `maskDescriptor` and the current mask descriptor describe the same mask.
This method returns `true` if the following conditions are met in both mask descriptors.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.Mask%2A> property is the same for both mask descriptors.
The validating type is the same for both mask descriptors.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.Name%2A> property is not considered, because the <xref:System.ComponentModel.MaskedTextProvider> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MaskedTextBox> classes do not use it.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor"></xref> to compare with the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor"></xref>.
`true` if the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor"></xref> is equal to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Serves as a hash function for a particular type.
A hash code for the current <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
Returns a value indicating whether the specified mask descriptor is valid and can be added to the masks list.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.IsValidMaskDescriptor%2A> method determines whether `maskDescriptor` is valid and can be added to the masks list.
A valid <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor> must meet the following conditions.
Not `null`.
Not `null` or an empty mask.
Not `null` or an empty name.
Not `null` or an empty sample.
The sample is correct based on the mask and all required edit characters have been provided.
This means the mask is completed but not necessarily full.
The sample is valid based on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.ValidatingType%2A> object, if any.
The mask descriptor to test for validity.
`true` if maskDescriptor is valid; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a value indicating whether the specified mask descriptor is valid, and provides an error description if it is not valid.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.IsValidMaskDescriptor%2A> method determines whether `maskDescriptor` is valid and can be added to the masks list.
A valid <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor> must meet the following conditions.
Not `null`.
Not `null` or an empty mask.
Not `null` or an empty name.
Not `null` or an empty sample.
The sample is correct based on the mask and all required edit characters have been provided.
This means the mask is completed but not necessarily full.
The sample is valid based on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.ValidatingType%2A> object, if any.
The mask descriptor to test for validity.
A string representing a validation error.
If no validation error occurred, the validationErrorDescription is .
`true` if maskDescriptor is valid; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the mask being defined.
The mask must contain only valid characters, as defined by the <xref:System.ComponentModel.MaskedTextProvider.IsValidMaskChar%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.MaskedTextProvider> class.
When a predefined mask is selected in [!INCLUDE[vsprvs](~/includes/vsprvs-md.md)], its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.Mask%2A> property is displayed.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the mask being defined.
Gets the user-friendly name of the mask.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.Name%2A> property is displayed in the **Mask Description** column in the visual editor for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MaskedTextBox> control.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the name or brief description of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.Mask"></xref>.
Gets a sample of a formatted string for the mask.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.Sample%2A> property is displayed in the **Data Format** column in the visual editor for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MaskedTextBox> control.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing text that is formatted by using the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.Mask"></xref>.
Returns a string that represents the current object.
A string that represents the current object.
Gets the type providing validation associated with the mask.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.MaskDescriptor.ValidatingType%2A> property is used to validate the input string after the mask has been applied to it.
It directly corresponds to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MaskedTextBox.ValidatingType%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MaskedTextBox> class.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that the formatted string is validated against.
